intro: Lagenophora commersonii, commonly known as the Commerson's lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Lagenophora commersonii is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils.
